page.title: 10Blakedown Parish Council
page.content: Blakedown Parish Council consists of various elected members of the community. It is responsible for such domestic details as the street lighting of the minor roads. The County Council has responsibility for the major roads. The Parish Council doesn't have much final power, but if any person wishes to change the size of a building, they need planning permission from the Rural District Council. However, for large buildings, the Parish Council must be contacted and allowed to state their views. One member represents the Council on the Board of Governors of Blakedown School. Members are also elected from the village to serve on the County Council which has greater control over Herefordshire and Worcestershire.
